result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan M Lennart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to:

[MK] cases #21CF258, #21CM176, #22CF67 called at 12:15pm
Defendant Ethan M Lennart in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " are entered on Case #21CT176-Count #1, Case #21CF258-Count #3, and Case #22CF67-Counts #1 and #3; factual basis is stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #21CF258-Count #2, and Case #22CF67-Count #2.

On Case #21CT176-Count # 1 the Court withholds sentences and places Mr. Lennart on Probation for one year with conditions: 
--To serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail with work-release privileges, to be served after the conditional jail term ordered in Waukesha County case #21CF1441  is completed.  The Court allows transfer of the service of the term to another county conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring 
--to pay a fine of $500 plus costs and surcharges
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and Agent approval
--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without the express written permission of the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores  

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
The Court orders outright [not as conditions of Probation]:
--Revocation of drivers license for 18 months
--AODA assessment
--Victim Impact Panel attendance 
--6 demerit points assessed
________________________

On Case #21CF258-Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Lennart  to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years consecutive.
[Clerk's inserted note:  post hearing the Court indicated to the clerk that the Court finds that Mr. Lennart is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Release Program] 
The Court gives 3 days credit for time already served.
The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Lennart on Probation for 3 years.

On Case #22CF67-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Lennart  to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years consecutive.
[Clerk's inserted note:  post hearing the Court indicated to the clerk that the Court finds that Mr. Lennart is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Release Program] 
The Court gives 3 days credit for time already served.
The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Lennart on Probation for 2 years. 

On Case #22CF67-Count #3 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lennart on Probation for 2 years.  

Conditions of Probation in Case #21CF258-Count #3 and in Case #22CF67-Counts #1 and #3 are: 
--as to Case #21CF258-Count #3 only: to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail with work-release privileges, to commence after the service of the jail term in Jefferson County Case #21CT176 is completed. The Court allows transfer of the service of the term to another county conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring 
--as to case#21CF258-Count #3 only: no contact with Thomas Henschel
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling 
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to pay costs, fees, surcharges 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given

[MK] cases #21CF258, #21CM176, #22CF67 called at 1:36pm
Defendant Ethan M Lennart appears.  Attorney Karl Huebner appears. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.  
In Case #22CF67 Waiver of Prelim is held:  
--Mr. Lennart waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

In Cases #21CF258 and #22CF67 Arraignment is held:
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
Mr. Lennart verifies that the 429 Windcrest Lane, Hartland address is current. 
recess 1:42pm 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on April 6th at 9:40am,  (2) Status Conference on June 2nd at 9:00am

[MK] cases #21CF258, #21CM176, #22CF67 called at 8:54am
Defendant Ethan M Lennart does not appear.  Attorney Karl Huebner appears. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Case #21CF258 is scheduled for Arraignment. Case #21CM176 is scheduled for Status Conference. Case #22CF67 is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing and the State's officer-witness has been present.  
Attorney Huebner indicates that Mr. Lennart contacted him earlier to say that the vehicle of his transport person is not working; he has been trying to arrange other transportation and he can be here this afternoon.  
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance.  
The Court passes over the cases until 1:30pm today.  
recess 8:57am

[ml] Case called at 1:17PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Ethan M Lennart appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (Def qualifies for PD services).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att Rumpf affirms that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

After a substantive conversation with Att Rumpf, the Court extends Att Huebner's appointment to this file as he is appointed on multiple other files the Defendant currently has open.

The Court requires a $1,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not discuss the facts of the case with Victim 1
